title: Mariyamfranklin
author: Mariyamfranklin
content: Koinpark is the best cryptocurrency exchange platform, recognized for its user-friendly design, a broad selection of supported cryptocurrencies, and robust security features. Several digital currencies are supported, including Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), and Litecoin (LTC) on KoinparkWebsite: https://koinpark.com/

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Best cryptocurrency platform yet the site just load a blank page? What is the point of announcing non-functional half-baked services?You are wasting time advertising air here.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on August 28, 2023, 11:28:30 PMBest cryptocurrency platform yet the site just load a blank page? What is the point of announcing non-functional half-baked services?You are wasting time advertising air here.You're lucky you got a blank page. this is what i getQuotePROXY SERVER IS NOT ALLOWED !I don't know why there is a restriction on access and want users to log in using their real IP addresses, but it's hard to find people interested in that here.You could put together a nice list of banned countries or at least require the user to verify their identity if they are using a VPN.In general, it seems that identity verification will be mandatory on this platform.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on August 29, 2023, 01:48:46 PMQuote from: Bitcoin_Arena on August 28, 2023, 11:28:30 PMBest cryptocurrency platform yet the site just load a blank page? What is the point of announcing non-functional half-baked services?You are wasting time advertising air here.You're lucky you got a blank page. this is what i getQuotePROXY SERVER IS NOT ALLOWED !Works fine on my end.QuoteI don't know why there is a restriction on access and want users to log in using their real IP addresses, but it's hard to find people interested in that here.You could put together a nice list of banned countries or at least require the user to verify their identity if they are using a VPN.In general, it seems that identity verification will be mandatory on this platform.It's true.All users must complete KYC, and for non-Indian users they only receive a passport document to pass verification. Strangely, I didn't find any information on restricted countries. @OP, does Koinpark really accept global users without exception?

comments.author: Tytanowy Janusz
comments.body: Quote from: rat03gopoh on August 29, 2023, 03:05:40 PM@OP, does Koinpark really accept global users without exception?Who cares? It is a no-name, barely functioning platform, or worse, a malfunctioning platform that a sane investor wouldn't entrust a dime to before proving its reliability. Calling it "best cryptocurrency exchange platform" is a joke.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: Tytanowy Janusz on August 31, 2023, 05:10:01 AMQuote from: rat03gopoh on August 29, 2023, 03:05:40 PM@OP, does Koinpark really accept global users without exception?Who cares? It is a no-name, barely functioning platform, or worse, a malfunctioning platform that a sane investor wouldn't entrust a dime to before proving its reliability. Calling it "best cryptocurrency exchange platform" is a joke.I just wanted to give the OP a chance to get more attention on this forum, the site actually loads without problems on my PC. Indeed, this exchange has to improve a few points especially responsiveness and trading appearance to make the "best" claim not just bullshit and make people laugh.I think they have really worked hard to build the business considering that they only started this year.https://coinmarketcap.com/exchanges/koinparkhttps://youtu.be/LtcbB0f2kjk

comments.author: Tytanowy Janusz
comments.body: the fact that they are trying, their webside works on some platforms (your pc), and are already visible on coinmarketcap doesn't change the fact that I wouldn't trust even a cent, just as I wouldn't trust 99% of the exchanges that are already on coinmarketcap, because for several years when I'm here, many of them appeared out of nowhere and disappeared with customer funds.

comments.author: iBaba
comments.body: Quote from: Mariyamfranklin on August 28, 2023, 10:59:06 AMKoinpark is the best cryptocurrency exchange platform I feel like this statement of yours is over hyped. Aside from the unpleasant reviews that are made by others here over the platform, I personally feel like you went too far to say that it is the best cryptocurrency platform. Meanwhile, before jumping into grandiose conclusions like this, I strongly suggest you to conduct your own research and choose a platform that meets your needs and preferences, as well as those of the greater population.

comments.author: fexkomin
comments.body: There are some bugs in the interface. Sometimes pages do not loading

comments.author: Hamza2424
comments.body: Quote from: Mariyamfranklin on August 28, 2023, 10:59:06 AMKoinpark is the best cryptocurrency exchange platform, recognized for its user-friendly design, a broad selection of supported cryptocurrencies, and robust security features. Several digital currencies are supported, including Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), and Litecoin (LTC) on KoinparkWebsite: https://koinpark.com/The ticker seems like ICC's logo Â   THB. Is it the same on the other side or just my imagination that today I'm very disheartened even the whole Asian cricket fans are disheartened? Well, that's not the topic buddy the Site is not even loading up please fix it before claiming anything on the side of the Best platform, you better have a look at the leading platforms, with that, you can differentiate what the best platform means what a Testing phase entry means.A few mistakes in the branding as well, but it's upto the developer team. As for the buddy who provided some social links I came to knew they started their Bussnies in 2023 so let's wait a few weeks and see what's going on.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: rat03gopoh on August 31, 2023, 06:09:40 AMI just wanted to give the OP a chance to get more attention on this forum, the site actually loads without problems on my PC. Indeed, this exchange has to improve a few points especially responsiveness and trading appearance to make the "best" claim not just bullshit and make people laugh.I think they have really worked hard to build the business considering that they only started this year.https://coinmarketcap.com/exchanges/koinparkhttps://youtu.be/LtcbB0f2kjkAnd yet they claim to have started from a long ago lol. Other figures appear to be heavily inflated as well given how they actually started this year. Further, a long time exchange with such high figures would have traces when you google them. With how dishonest they are from the getgo and simple things, I wouldn't give them such chance.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: Potato Chips on September 02, 2023, 11:34:55 PMAnd yet they claim to have started from a long ago lol. Other figures appear to be heavily inflated as well given how they actually started this year. This one escaped my notice, I think they're really making false claims. 40M+ orders achieved just since the beginning of this year, even I can't find "Koinpark" keyword in india section till this post was made.I checked the whois status of all their ecosystem domains and all were also registered this year. Curious about which domain they started in 2014.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: Potato Chips on September 02, 2023, 11:34:55 PMThis is interesting and often ends badly for everyone who tries to deceive others that the platform is old and has thousands of followers. Not to mention the 2.4 million from 2014.I note that Mariyamfranklin is actively involved in promoting this scam, if he continues he may get a negative trust.

comments.author: Latviand
comments.body: Everyone's saying that they're the best cryptocurrency platform or the best X with X being their service or goods everyday for a long time now so I don't know if it still holds any meaning, if everyone's the best then there's really no one special.Quote from: fexkomin on September 02, 2023, 08:03:34 PMThere are some bugs in the interface. Sometimes pages do not loadingDon't have to worry about that, OP seems to be an active promoter of scams and fake websites.

comments.author: michellee
comments.body: I can visit the site without any problems but I haven't decided to register and just look at the outside. But for exchange sites that have just been registered in January 2023, the sites still need to do more frequent promotions.You can check it from here:Code:https://who.is/whois/koinpark.comAll new sites, whatever it is, will say their site is the best. So it's no wonder that @ OP said the same thing because he might be a rep for his site. But if he is a representative of his site, it would be better for him to ANN his site rather than just provide a thread like that.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: rat03gopoh on September 03, 2023, 08:03:07 AMI checked the whois status of all their ecosystem domains and all were also registered this year. Curious about which domain they started in 2014.I've seen shady crypto services try this excuse -- that they have moved domain or changed their branding, but most often, they can't back this information. I did search about Koinpark previously and results returned dates from this year. A long time exchange with high figures would return results that matches when cross-checked on google.Of course, if OP has a solid proof to back such claim, I'm pretty sure the community is willing to listen. In the mean time, it is best to err on the side of caution.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: Potato Chips on September 02, 2023, 11:34:55 PMAnd yet they claim to have started from a long ago lol. Other figures appear to be heavily inflated as well given how they actually started this year. Further, a long time exchange with such high figures would have traces when you google them. With how dishonest they are from the getgo and simple things, I wouldn't give them such chance.The @OP is just trying his/her best to promote the worlds best scam exchange with fake statistics to the audience of the Bitcoin Talk in hope that he/she may be successful in his/her goal. I think either @OP is drunk or someone who isn't sure that what he/she is trying to do. No member of this forum is naive enough to believe someone's words without any research and @OP thought we will accept his/her words and join that exchange. I must say that anyone who is trying to promote a site like that is a scammer and from this post I can say that @OP is basically here to scam the users of the forum. He/she won't be able to accomplish his/her goals and I think he/she will soon leave this forum because we have caught the fishy things about the platform.
